data.title: :racehorse: wrap loop of config.setDefaults() in transact()
data.body: When config.setDefaults() is called "did-change" event emitted per one config key. This hits performance when package has large set of default configs (like [atom-beautify](https://github.com/Glavin001/atom-beautify/issues/679). Without transact: With transact: Thanks!

data.title: Atom 1.6.0 editor doesnt show, dev tools instead (Linux Mint 17.1 )
data.body:
Hi, I was using Atom 1.6 normally on Mint 17.1. (I installed it on a 32bit machin using webupd8 ppa)
After updating some packages within Atom it broke.
Now, when I open Atom i get  the Developer tools console ...

I tried reinstalling and cleaning paths without success.
I really appreciate some help!

data.title: Atom 1.6 Frequently Freezes with Remote Project Folders (All Platforms)
data.body:
### Description

_Note - Title was edited to reflect that the issue is reported on all platforms, though the following report was originally for Ubuntu 14.04_

Since updating to version 1.6.0 (from 1.5.4, where the problem didn't exist) Atom freezes when trying to open files in networked project folders (i.e. remote folders added to an Atom Project) which are connected via SFTP _(edit: Confirmed to also occur on Samba, SSHFS, etc )._ I have run Atom in safe mode and also tried 1.7 beta and had the same problem.  The networked folders are connected through the built-in "Connect to Server" feature in Ubuntu's Nautilus file browser.  Ubuntu 14.04 was the platform tested.

The **Editor is not responding** message appears after waiting for nearly thirty seconds, and choosing **Keep Waiting** sometimes unfreezes the window, though sometimes not. The problem happens again as soon as another file is selected from the project tree. Atom also commonly freezes when restarting the program with these project folders added, and if it does eventually unfreeze it _will_ soon freeze again when trying to open a project file.

The problem occurs with linked folders on local virtual servers as well as remote servers, so high WAN latency does not appear to be the issue. Atom does not seem to have any CPU spikes during the freeze either as far as I can tell.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Mount a remote folder via SSH/SFTP in Ubuntu using its Nautilus file browser ('Connect to server' option).
2. Add the folder to an Atom project using the standard folder browser.
3. Once folder is added try to view folder structure or open a file in Atom's tree view.

**Expected behavior:** 
Expected behavior is that the remote project folder operates identically to a local project folder.

**Actual behavior:**
Atom repeatedly freezes for an extended period of time when using the project tree viewer for remote folders and files.
### Versions

Problem occurs in Atom 1.6.0 and later.  Problem did not exist in Atom 1.5.4.  Platform is Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.

data.title: Font-family name field in the settings (unnecessary quote mark)
data.body:
### Description

Problem to set the font-family in the settings.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open settings.
2. Scroll down until font-family setting.
3. Try entering the name. (e.g. Meslo, "Meslo")
4. Meslo" and "Meslo work.

**Expected behavior:** Enter only the font-family name.

**Actual behavior:** It is necessary to add one quote mark (") after font-family name to work.
### Versions

Atom 1.6.0
Windows 10

data.title: (updating Atom 1.5.4 --> 1.6.0) After pressing 'Help|Update and Restart' Atom didn't restart
data.body:
_Initially having Atom 1.5.4 stable in win10 6x4._
Today after launching Atom I noticed in Atom's statusbar that update 1.6.0 was available.
So, I pressed `Help|Update and Restart` but Atom didn't restart by itself: I had to manually launch it.

There was no relevant entry in windows Event Viewer (i.e. "Atom crashed" or something like that)

data.title: Pending pane doesn't work
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? -- Safe mode doesn't have tree view.
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Pending pane doesn't show up when click at a file in tree view. (`Allow Pending Pane Items` is checked. )
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Click at a file in tree view

**Expected behavior:**
Pending pane show up when click at a file in tree view.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
Nothing happen, just a file name is highlighted.
### Versions

1.6.0

thanks,

data.title: Git --wait stalls after initiating a commit (does not respond after saving commit message)
data.body:
### Description

Git does not recover or submit commit after initiating atom via "git commit" in bash.  I write commit msg, ctrl+save commit, and and ctrl+w, ctrl+w to exit atom. Git in bash appears to be waiting for a stop to --wait, does not send commit.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Modify atom.cmd file to recent modified version: https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/4d9e2b865b1f136bd1400eb3c67cb98dfc7571f2
2. type git commit into the git bash terminal.
3. write commit, ctrl+s, ctrl+w, ctrl+w .

**Expected behavior:** A commit to be made from atom, after initiating the commit from git bash

**Actual behavior:** git bash stalls and behaves as if it is waiting for a stop signal to the --wait command. 

NOTE: I can successful commit in atom by ctrl+shift+h and then selecting commit; I cannot initiate this process from the bash. 
### Versions

git version 2.7.4; atom version1.60 with modified atom.cmd (version 1.60 won't launch atom per other issue), windows 10

data.title: Atom 1.7.0 beta0 not opening from command line in portable mode Windows 7
data.body:
I always open Atom from the command line, and today I updated Atom to 1.7.0 beta0 and now when I open a directory from the command line I get the following errors:

```
atom -n .
/e/devtools/atom/bin/../app-1.7.0-beta0/resources/cli/atom.cmd: line 1: @echo: command not found
/e/devtools/atom/bin/../app-1.7.0-beta0/resources/cli/atom.cmd: line 3: SET: command not found
/e/devtools/atom/bin/../app-1.7.0-beta0/resources/cli/atom.cmd: line 4: SET: command not found
/e/devtools/atom/bin/../app-1.7.0-beta0/resources/cli/atom.cmd: line 6: syntax error near unexpected token `('
/e/devtools/atom/bin/../app-1.7.0-beta0/resources/cli/atom.cmd: line 6: `FOR %%a IN (%*) DO ('
```

I can successfully open Atom manually or through the Explorer context menus.

Windows 7 x64
Atom 1.7.0 beta0
apm  1.8.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 1.9.5.msysgit.0
visual studio 2012

data.title: Hitting an unbound key sequence sharing a prefix with a bound sequence freezes atom
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?

I am not sure if this issue fits here or over at https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap, apologies.
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom freezes or crashes when a non-bound key binding shares the same prefix as a bound key binding.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create an example keybinding in your keymap file; (this is a trivial example; while they make Atom effectively non-functional, these types of bindings are, I expect, not so uncommon for us vim mode folk):

```
    'atom-text-editor':
      'space b d': 'tabs:close-tab'
```
1. Hitting space, b, d will delete the tab as expected.
2. Now: instead, hit space b y (or any other unbound key).

**Expected behavior:** Nothing happens.

**Actual behavior:** Atom freezes for an extended time.  Attempting this in safe mode crashes, otherwise it freezes and eventually shows a stack trace referenced in #6102.  However, this does not appear to be the same issue from what is being discussed there.  Development console in addition shows:

```
    Uncaught exception
        module.exports.KeymapManager.simulateTextInput @ (program):446
    Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
        /usr/lib/atom/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:459
```
### Versions

Affects 1.6.0 and 1.5.4.  Downgrading to 1.5.3 solves the issue.

data.title: Atom sidebar can only open one file
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Clicking a file on the sidebar will only open a new tab if you have never clicked on a file before. Additional clicks will 'reuse' the existing tab instead of leaving the existing files open.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Click on a file in the sidebar
2. Click another file in the sidebar

Video of bug: https://youtu.be/Je1lO-lIajI

**Expected behavior:**
Both files open in separate tabs

**Actual behavior:**
Only the last file clicked is open. The tab used from the last click is 'reused'.
### Versions

1.6.0

data.title: Remove an unnecessary call to then().
data.body:
I see that this file has a little use of async/await and many uses of `then()`.
Things would be much less verbose and much more linear if async/await were used throughout.
Would Atom be open to a PR that changes this?

For bonus points, we could also replace `'use babel'` with `/* @flow */` at the top of the file :)

data.title: Atom 1.6.0 - Cannot open two scripts with the same name
data.body: It simply override the content with the new script!!!!!

data.title: Settings view opens in wrong pane without working tab
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Opening the settings from another pane than the one it is currently open in causes the settings to open without a tab.

See image where settings tab is in the right pane, but settings is shown in the left pane but another tab has focus and should be the one shown.
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1058982/13875794/468dec1a-ed00-11e5-9cea-f9e089c109b7.PNG)

How to know if correct repository, maybe its settings view, maybe tabs, maybe here?
### Steps to Reproduce
1. New window ctrl+shift+n.
2. Split right so you have two panes.
3. Focus on left pane.
4. Open settings with ctrl+,. Settings open normally in the left pane.
5. Focus on right pane.
6. Open settings with ctrl+,. Exception in console happens.
7. Open settings with ctrl+,. Settings open in right pane but tab is in left pane.
8. Can close left settings tab without closing settings.

**Expected behavior:** Settings to always have tab in and that tab to be correct. To not throw an exception in the console.

**Actual behavior:** Incorrect or no tab associated with settings.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.
atom --version
1.6.0

apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 1.9.2.msysgit.0
visual studio

data.title: Atom 1.7.0 beta0 crashes on startup under Arch Linux
data.body:
Hi,

I have noticed that Atom 1.7.0-beta0 crashes on startup on Arch Linux. Despite this, Atom 1.6.0 installed on the same Arch Linux installation is working fine without issue. It does not matter if I start 1.7.0-beta0 from the command-line with `atom-beta` or from its `.desktop` file launcher. I have tried launching it with `atom-beta --safe .` and still it crashed on me. `atom-beta` returns the following output, if it helps:

``` bash
/usr/bin/atom-beta: line 115: 14844 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) nohup "$ATOM_PATH" --executed-from="$(pwd)" --pid=$$ "$@" > "$ATOM_HOME/nohup.out" 2>&1
App load time: 434ms
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: 
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: 
```

How did I install Atom 1.7.0 beta0? By running `makepkg -si --noconfirm` in [this subdirectory](https://github.com/fusion809/PKGBUILDs/tree/master/atom-editor-beta) of my PKGBUILD GitHub repository. In case I end up updating this GitHub repo, here is the present PKGBUILD I am using:

``` bash
# Contributor: Matheus de Alcantara <matheus.de.alcantara@gmail.com>
# Maintainer: Brenton Horne <brentonhorne77 at gmail dot com>

pkgname=atom-editor-beta
_pkgrel=0
_pkgver=1.7.0
pkgver="${_pkgver}.${_pkgrel}"
pkgrel=1
pkgdesc='Chrome-based text editor from GitHub - Beta Channel'
arch=('x86_64' 'i686')
url='https://github.com/atom/atom'
license=('MIT')
depends=('alsa-lib' 'gconf' 'gtk2' 'libgnome-keyring' 'libnotify' 'libxtst' 'nodejs' 'nss' 'python2')
optdepends=('gvfs: file deletion support')
makedepends=('git' 'npm')
conflicts=('atom-editor-beta-bin')
install=atom.install
source=("https://github.com/atom/atom/archive/v${_pkgver}-beta${_pkgrel}.tar.gz")
sha256sums=('d370f725a1b6fab0583f7d412f189a3c35603a7472a6566b188d0c2ae7e98bdf')

prepare() {
    cd "$srcdir/atom-${_pkgver}-beta${_pkgrel}"

  sed -i -e "/exception-reporting/d" \
           -e "/metrics/d" package.json

  sed    -e "s/<%= description %>/$pkgdesc/" \
         -e "s|<%= appName %>|Atom Beta|"\
         -e "s|<%= installDir %>/share/<%= appFileName %>/atom|/usr/bin/atom-beta|"\
         -e "s|<%= iconPath %>|atom-beta.png|"\
         -e "s|GNOME;||" \
         -e "s|text/plain;|application/javascript;application/json;application/postscript;application/x-csh;application/x-desktop;application/x-httpd-eruby;application/x-httpd-php;application/x-httpd-php3;application/x-httpd-php4;application/x-httpd-php5;application/x-latex;application/x-msdos-program;application/x-ruby;application/x-sh;application/x-shellscript;application/x-sql;application/x-tcl;application/x-tex;application/xhtml+xml;application/xml;application/xml-dtd;application/xslt+xml;text/css;text/csv;text/html;text/plain;text/xml;text/xml-dtd;text/x-asm;text/x-bibtex;text/x-boo;text/x-c++;text/x-c++hdr;text/x-c++src;text/x-c;text/x-chdr;text/x-csh;text/x-csrc;text/x-dsrc;text/x-diff;text/x-eiffel;text/x-fortran;text/x-go;text/x-haskell;text/x-java;text/x-java-source;text/x-lua;text/x-makefile;text/x-markdown;text/x-objc;text/x-pascal;text/x-perl;text/x-php;text/x-python;text/x-ruby;text/x-scala;text/x-scheme;text/x-sh;text/x-tcl;text/x-tex;text/x-vala;text/yaml;|" \
         resources/linux/atom.desktop.in > resources/linux/atom-beta.desktop
}

build() {
    cd "$srcdir/atom-${_pkgver}-beta${_pkgrel}"

    export PYTHON=/usr/bin/python2
    until ./script/build --build-dir "$srcdir/atom-build"; do :; done
}

package() {
    cd "$srcdir/atom-${_pkgver}-beta${_pkgrel}"

    script/grunt install --build-dir "$srcdir/atom-build" --install-dir "$pkgdir/usr"

    if [[ -d "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom" ]]; then
    mv "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom" "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta"
    fi
  if [[ -f "$pkgdir/usr/bin/atom" ]]; then
        mv "$pkgdir/usr/bin/atom" "$pkgdir/usr/bin/atom-beta"
  fi
    if [[ -d "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm" ]]; then
        mv "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm" "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm-beta"
  fi
    if [[ -f "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm-beta/node_modules/.bin/apm" ]]; then
        mv "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm-beta/node_modules/.bin/apm" "$pkgdir/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm-beta/node_modules/.bin/apm-beta"
  fi
    if [[ -f "$pkgdir/usr/bin/apm" ]]; then
        rm "$pkgdir/usr/bin/apm"
    fi
    ln -sf "${pkgdir}/usr/share/atom-beta/resources/app/apm-beta/node_modules/.bin/apm-beta" "${pkgdir}/usr/bin/apm-beta"
    if [[ -f "$pkgdir/usr/share/applications/atom.desktop" ]]; then
    rm "$pkgdir/usr/share/applications/atom.desktop"
    fi
    install -Dm644 resources/linux/atom-beta.desktop "$pkgdir/usr/share/applications/atom-beta.desktop"
    install -Dm644 resources/app-icons/beta/png/1024.png "$pkgdir/usr/share/pixmaps/atom-beta.png"
    install -Dm644 LICENSE.md "$pkgdir/usr/share/licenses/$pkgname/LICENSE.md"
}
```

and here is the `atom.install` file:

``` bash
post_install() {
  update-desktop-database -q
}

post_upgrade() {
  post_install
}

post_remove() {
  post_install
}
```

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Assertion Failed Error on Git repos with missing path
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

If a git repo has a missing submodule path (compared to what's set up in git), Atom throws assertion errors.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a git repo
2. Include a submodule
3. Delete the submodule path from your working tree, but don't really "remove" the submodule
4. Open the project directory in Atom

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

A usable Atom

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Atom throws C++ "Assertion Failed" errors repeatedly, and throws uncaught errors in console:

```
Uncaught (in promise) Error: Failed to resolve path 'C:\path\to\submodule\dir': The system cannot find the file specified.



    at Error (native)
```

![screenshot 2016-03-17 19 53 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/165937/13872651/51ab7132-eca9-11e5-8703-d82f45fc3a7a.png)
### Versions

apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.3
git 2.7.1.windows.1
visual studio 2013

data.title: Atom 1.7.0-beta0 fails to open from dock
data.body:
### Description

Since Atom 1.7.0-beta0, Atom fails to open when initiated from the dock (Mac). It seems to work fine when opened from the terminal.

When called from the dock, a debugger window appear with the traceback

```
TypeError: Path must be a string. Received undefined
    at assertPath (path.js:8)
    at Object.posix.join (path.js:479)
    at Object.fsPlus.resolve (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/fs-plus/lib/fs-plus.js:461)
    at new Config (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/config.js:81)
    at new AtomEnvironment (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:181)
    at module.exports (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:23)
    at setupWindow (index.js:87)
    at window.onload (index.js:41)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom from the dock icon.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.0-beta0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

OSX: 10.11.3

Installed packages:
├── Sublime-Style-Column-Selection@1.5.1

├── set-syntax@0.3.0
└── synced-sidebar@0.4.3

data.title: Uncaught Error: Pane items must be objects. Attempted to add item undefined.
data.body:
**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open a new empty Atom in safe mode
1. If an untitled tab was created by the `Open Empty Editor on Start` configuration option close it so the pane is empty
1. Run `pane:split-[direction]-and-move-active-item` from the command palette

**Atom Version**: 1.7.0-beta0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.4
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Pane items must be objects. Attempted to add item undefined.


data.title: Bump status-bar
[WIP] Ensure cursor is visible after showing panels
data.body:
Fixes #8068.

So this is an interesting one.

We want to ensure the cursor is visible after we show a panel. The tricky bit is that we have to do this _after_ the text editor’s been laid out to include the new panel.

@atom/core I’d love to get some thoughts on how we can accomplish this in a way that doesn't make me sad inside.
